verses.verse: Thou shalt not sacrifice<WH2076> unto Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> an ox<WH7794>, or a sheep<WH7716>, wherein is a blemish<WH3971>, or anything evil<WH7451>; for that is an abomination<WH8441> unto Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.

If there be found<WH4672> in the midst<WH7130> of thee<WH259>, within any of thy gates<WH8179> which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee<WH376>, man or woman<WH802>, that doeth<WH6213> that which is evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, in transgressing<WH5674> his covenant<WH1285>,

and hath gone<WH3212> and served<WH5647> other<WH312> gods<WH430>, and worshipped<WH7812> them<WH8121>, or the sun, or the moon<WH3394>, or any of the host<WH6635> of heaven<WH8064>, which I have not commanded<WH6680>;

and it be told<WH5046> thee<WH8085>, and thou hast heard of it<WH1875>, then shalt thou inquire diligently<WH3190>; and<WH571>, behold, if it be true, and the thing<WH1697> certain<WH3559>, that such abomination<WH8441> is wrought<WH6213> in Israel<WH3478>,

then shalt thou bring forth<WH3318> that man<WH376> or that woman<WH802>, who hath done<WH6213> this evil<WH7451> thing<WH1697>, unto thy gates<WH8179>, even the man<WH376> or the woman<WH802>; and thou shalt stone<WH5619> them to death<WH4191> with stones<WH5619>.

At the mouth<WH6310> of two<WH8147> witnesses<WH5707>, or three<WH7969> witnesses<WH5707>, shall he that is to die<WH4191> be put to death<WH4191>; at the mouth<WH6310> of one<WH259> witness<WH5707> he shall not be put to death<WH4191>.

The hand<WH3027> of the witnesses<WH5707> shall be first<WH7223> upon him to put him to death<WH4191>, and afterward<WH314> the hand<WH3027> of all the people<WH5971>. So thou shalt put<WH1197> away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from the midst of thee<WH7130>.

If there arise a matter<WH1697> too hard<WH6381> for thee in judgment<WH4941>, between blood<WH1818> and blood<WH1818>, between plea<WH1779> and plea<WH1779>, and between stroke<WH5061> and stroke<WH5061>, being matters<WH1697> of controversy<WH7379> within thy gates<WH8179>; then shalt thou arise<WH6965>, and get thee up<WH5927> unto the place<WH4725> which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> shall choose<WH977>;

and thou shalt come<WH935> unto the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881>, and unto the judge<WH8199> that shall be in those days<WH3117>: and thou shalt inquire<WH1875>; and they shall show<WH5046> thee the sentence<WH1697> of judgment<WH4941>.

And thou shalt do<WH6213> according to the tenor of the sentence<WH6310> which they shall show<WH5046> thee from that place<WH4725> which Jehovah<WH3068> shall choose<WH977>; and thou shalt observe<WH8104> to do<WH6213> according to all that they shall teach thee<WH3384>:

according to the tenor<WH6310> of the law<WH8451> which they shall teach<WH3384> thee<WH4941>, and according to the judgment which they shall tell<WH559> thee<WH6213>, thou shalt do; thou shalt not turn aside<WH5493> from the sentence<WH1697> which they shall show<WH5046> thee<WH3225>, to the right hand, nor to the left<WH8040>.

And the man<WH376> that doeth<WH6213> presumptuously<WH2087>, in not hearkening<WH8085> unto the priest<WH3548> that standeth<WH5975> to minister<WH8334> there before Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, or unto the judge<WH8199>, even that man<WH376> shall die<WH4191>: and thou shalt put away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from Israel<WH3478>.
And all the people<WH5971> shall hear<WH8085>, and fear<WH3372>, and do no more presumptuously<WH2102>.

When thou art come<WH935> unto the land<WH776> which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee<WH3423>, and shalt possess it<WH3427>, and shalt dwell therein<WH559>, and shalt say, I will set<WH7760> a king<WH4428> over me<WH1471>, like all the nations that are round about me<WH5439>;

thou shalt surely<WH7760> set<WH7760> him king<WH4428> over thee<WH3068>, whom Jehovah thy God<WH430> shall choose<WH977>: one from among<WH7130> thy brethren<WH251> shalt thou set<WH7760> king<WH4428> over thee<WH3201>; thou mayest not put<WH5414> a foreigner<WH5237> over thee<WH251>, who is not thy brother.

Only he shall not multiply<WH7235> horses<WH5483> to himself<WH5971>, nor cause the people to return<WH7725> to Egypt<WH4714>, to the end that he may multiply<WH7235> horses<WH5483>; forasmuch as Jehovah<WH3068> hath said<WH559> unto you<WH3254>, Ye shall henceforth return<WH7725> no more that way<WH1870>.
Neither shall he multiply<WH7235> wives<WH802> to himself<WH3824>, that his heart turn<WH5493> not away<WH3966>: neither shall he greatly multiply<WH7235> to himself silver<WH3701> and gold<WH2091>.

And it shall be<WH3427>, when he sitteth upon the throne<WH3678> of his kingdom<WH4467>, that he shall write<WH3789> him a copy<WH4932> of this law<WH8451> in a book<WH5612>, out of that which is before<WH6440> the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881>:

and it shall be with him<WH7121>, and he shall read therein all the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416>; that he may learn<WH3925> to fear<WH3372> Jehovah<WH3068> his God<WH430>, to keep<WH8104> all the words<WH1697> of this law<WH8451> and these statutes<WH2706>, to do them<WH6213>;

that his heart<WH3824> be not lifted up<WH7311> above his brethren<WH251>, and that he turn not aside<WH5493> from the commandment<WH4687>, to the right hand<WH3225>, or to the left<WH8040>: to the end that he may prolong<WH748> his days<WH3117> in his kingdom<WH4467>, he and his children<WH1121>, in the midst<WH7130> of Israel<WH3478>.
